IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: As a community foundation the organization is chartered to improve the cultural, economic, social, health and educational quality of life for residents of Yakima County and to help donors achieve their philanthropic goals.
IRS990.MissionDescription: As a community foundation the organization is chartered to improve the cultural, economic, social, health and educational quality of life for residents of Yakima County and to help donors achieve their philanthropic goals.
IRS990.Description: The organization is chartered to improve the economic, cultural, social, health and educational quality of life for residents of Yakima County with special attention to unmet needs and to help donors achieve their philanthropic goals.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Documents including policies and conflict of interest statements are provided upon request. Financial statements and 990's are included on the companies external website, which is available to the public. Please see www.yvcf.com

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION PLAN IS ADMINISTERED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE EMPLOYER(THE "BOARD"). THE BOARD MAY AT ANY TIME APPOINT AN ADMINISTRATIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF NO LESS THAN TWO MEMBERS TO ADMINISTER THE PLAN ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD. THE ADMINISTRATIVE COMMITTEE HAS THE AUTHORITY TO ADMINISTER THE COMPENSATION PLAN IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE EXPRESSED TERMS OF THE PLAN. ALL DECISIONS MADE BY THE COMMITTEE THAT ARE MADE IN GOOD FAITH, SHALL BE FINAL, CONCLUSIVE, AND BINDING UPON ALL PERSONS. ALL ACTIONS OF THE ADMINISTRATIVE COMMITTEE SHALL REQUIRE THE AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF MEMBERS WHO CONSTITUTE A MAJORITY OF A QUORUM.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Yakima Valley Community Foundation expects representatives to fully disclose perceived, potential, and actual conflicts of interest to the appropriate individuals in accordance with this policy in advance of any decision-making, and excuse themselves from decisions where a conflict of interest could interfere with objective decision-making. Annual conflict of interest policy form signed by all staff and board members

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Approval by the budget and audit committee, recommend approval to full board vote.
